title.narrative: GUY1.3 QUALITY EDUCATION Early Child Development (ECD) UPSTREAM

description.narrative: Priority gaps in Early Childhood Development and Child Friendly Schooling are addressed through the development of evidence based plans, guidelines and M&E systems, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Education â€“ General, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, Governments of Guyana and Suriname have in place systems for continuous monitoring of the situation for boys, girls, and women in the general population and in the hinterland and rural areas of Guyana and the interior of Suriname based on reliable disaggregated data and are using the data to formulate and continuously update equity-and gender-sensitive national and sub- national plans to guide continuing progress in the survival, development, protection and participation of children and women at the aggregated level and among disadvantaged groups based on CRC and CEDAW.

description.narrative: The Legal Regulation for Child Care Services was adopted and provides clear regulations on how all public and private services should serve children and their families in the most appropriate manner | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017
